name: viralrecon-influenza-genotyping
description: Influenza virus genotyping pipeline for seasonal surveillance. Analyzes Illumina metagenomic sequencing data to identify influenza strains, determine subtypes (e.g., H1N1, H3N2), and support public health monitoring of circulating flu variants.
content:
Influenza Genotyping Pipeline

This application implements the nf-core/viralrecon pipeline specifically configured for influenza virus genotyping in public health surveillance. It analyzes Illumina metagenomic sequencing data from clinical respiratory samples to identify influenza strains and subtypes, enabling rapid tracking of seasonal flu variants for epidemiological monitoring.

Key Features

  • Metagenomic Analysis: Processes shotgun sequencing data directly from clinical respiratory samples without amplicon enrichment

  • Strain Identification: Maps reads to influenza reference genome (NC_007373.1 - Influenza A H3N2) to determine viral presence and subtype

  • Variant Detection: Identifies genetic variations that may indicate antigenic drift or novel reassortant strains

  • Quality Control: Comprehensive QC metrics including read depth, genome coverage, and assembly quality statistics

  • Batch Processing: Efficiently processes multiple samples in parallel for high-throughput surveillance

Use Case

Designed for public health laboratories conducting influenza genomic surveillance. Rapidly identifies circulating influenza subtypes (H1N1, H3N2, B/Victoria, B/Yamagata) from clinical specimens, supporting vaccine strain selection decisions and monitoring for pandemic threats.

Pipeline Outputs

  • Consensus Sequences: Assembled influenza genome segments ready for phylogenetic analysis

  • Variant Calls: VCF files identifying mutations relative to reference strain

  • Coverage Statistics: Genome coverage plots and depth metrics for each segment

  • Quality Reports: MultiQC summary with mapping statistics and quality scores

  • Alignment Files: BAM files with reads mapped to influenza reference genome

Built using Nextflow with containerized processes for maximum reproducibility. Part of the nf-core community pipelines.
command: export NXF_CACHE_DIR=/camber_work/temp/.nextflow; export NXF_LOG_FILE=/home/camber/jobs/${JOB_ID}/outputs/nextflow.log; nextflow run nf-core/viralrecon -r 2.6.0 --input ${input} --outdir ${outdir} --platform illumina --protocol metagenomic --genome 'NC_007373.1' --max_memory 128.GB --max_cpus 16 -c /etc/mpi/nextflow.camber.config -ansi-log false -profile k8s

spec.label: Sample Sheet

spec.description: Path to CSV file containing sample information. Format: sample,fastq_1,fastq_2. Each row represents one sample with paired-end FASTQ files (local paths or URLs). For metagenomic influenza surveillance data.

spec.label: Output Directory
spec.name: outdir
spec.description: Output directory for analysis results. If not specified, results will be written to ~/jobs/<jobid>/outputs/. Results include consensus sequences, variant calls, coverage statistics, and QC reports.
